meanings.sent1: He dishonored his family by lying about his actions.
meanings.sent2: She dishonored her teacher by cheating on the test.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy dishonored the clean floor by tracking mud everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist dishonored the blank wall with his unauthorized artwork.
meanings.sent5: The knight felt dishonored after losing the jousting match in front of the whole kingdom.

meanings.definition: Fail to keep an agreement or promise; violate a trust.
meanings.sent1: They dishonored their friendship by spreading rumors behind each other's backs.
meanings.sent2: The company dishonored the contract by not delivering the promised goods on time.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful student accidentally dishonored the group project deadline.
meanings.sent4: The politician dishonored the public's trust by breaking his campaign promises.
meanings.sent5: The athlete felt dishonored after being caught using performance-enhancing drugs.

meanings.definition: No longer considered worthy of respect or honor.
meanings.sent1: The dishonored soldier returned from war with a tarnished reputation.
meanings.sent2: The once respected professor became dishonored after a plagiarism scandal.
meanings.sent3: The old, torn flag looked dishonored hanging limply in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building stood dishonored in the middle of the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The broken statue lay dishonored in the overgrown garden, forgotten by all.
